<a id="RID"></a>

# RID

A handle for a [Resource](Resource.md)'s unique identifier.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

The RID [Variant](Variant.md) type is used to access a low-level resource by its unique ID. RIDs are opaque, which means they do not grant access to the resource by themselves. They are used by the low-level server classes, such as [DisplayServer](DisplayServer.md), [RenderingServer](RenderingServer.md), [TextServer](TextServer.md), etc.

A low-level resource may correspond to a high-level [Resource](Resource.md), such as [Texture](Texture.md) or [Mesh](Mesh.md).

\ **Note:** RIDs are only useful during the current session. It won't correspond to a similar resource if sent over a network, or loaded from a file at a later time.

<div class="note">
There are notable differences when using this API with C#. See the C# differences documentation for more information.

</div>

## Method Descriptions

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_id**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#RID_method_get_id)

Returns the ID of the referenced low-level resource.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="RID_method_is_valid"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_valid**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#RID_method_is_valid)

Returns ``true`` if the **RID** is not ``0``.

## Operator Descriptions

<a id="RID_operator_neq_RID"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator !=**\ (\ right\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#RID_operator_neq_RID)

Returns ``true`` if the **RID**\\ s are not equal.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="RID_operator_lt_RID"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &lt;**\ (\ right\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#RID_operator_lt_RID)

Returns ``true`` if the **RID**'s ID is less than `right`'s ID.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="RID_operator_lte_RID"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &lt;=**\ (\ right\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#RID_operator_lte_RID)

Returns ``true`` if the **RID**'s ID is less than or equal to `right`'s ID.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="RID_operator_eq_RID"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator ==**\ (\ right\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#RID_operator_eq_RID)

Returns ``true`` if both **RID**\\ s are equal, which means they both refer to the same low-level resource.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="RID_operator_gt_RID"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &gt;**\ (\ right\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#RID_operator_gt_RID)

Returns ``true`` if the **RID**'s ID is greater than `right`'s ID.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="RID_operator_gte_RID"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &gt;=**\ (\ right\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#RID_operator_gte_RID)

Returns ``true`` if the **RID**'s ID is greater than or equal to `right`'s ID.
